alert.note: Alert for Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued June 11 at 6:43PM PDT until June 15 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Portland OR has issued a Flood Watch for the following rivers in Oregon...Washington... Columbia River at Vancouver affecting Greater Vancouver Area and Greater Portland Metro Area zones. Columbia River at Longview affecting I-5 Corridor in Cowlitz County and Lower Columbia zones. .Periods of heavy rain over the past 48 hours combined with melting snowpack in the mountains has resulted in rising river levels. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO LATE WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Columbia River at Vancouver. * WHEN...From late tonight to late Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Above 16.0 feet, expect flooding of some islands and low areas, with minor impacts for parks, trails, and parking lots along the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:06 PM PDT Saturday the stage was 14.9 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached based on the latest forecast information. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by 5 PM PDT Sunday.
